dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Scholten (for herself and Mr. Wied) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend section 173 of title 23, United States Code, to require the Secretary of Transportation to set aside certain amounts provided under the rural surface transportation grant program for regional hubs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Rural Upgrades for Road Access and Local Growth Act of 2025.
Section 173 of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by inserting after paragraph (3) the following:

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall reserve 30 percent of the amounts made available for the program for each fiscal year to provide grants for eligible projects located in communities with populations of between 10,000 and 75,000, whether or not 1 or more of such communities are considered part of an urbanized area as designated by the United States Census Bureau.

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (5), as so redesignated, by striking or (3) and inserting (3), or (4); and
in paragraph (1) by striking 60 days and inserting 3 days;
in paragraph (2) by striking 60-day period and inserting 3-day period; and
in paragraph (3) by striking 60-day period and inserting 3-day period.
